boat.name: Letty May
boat.full_description:
'Letty May', built 1978, is a Memory 19, designed by Tony Robinson, MRINA, when he was working at James and Stone in 1974. The lines are based on a boat named 'Brownie' built in the 1920s. Brownie's owner had wanted a boat based on Stone's workboats of the turn of the century.

The first owner bought her as a kit open version and built his own cabin, not liking the GRP standard cabins of that time. The second owner kept her on Walton Backwaters for 19 years.

Since 2000 she has been sailing and racing out of the River Blackwater.
boat.short_description: 'Letty May', built 1978, is a Memory 19, shoal draft gaff sloop based on Brightlingsea workboats of about 1900.

for_sales.sales_text: "Letty May" is a 1978 Memory 19 gaff sloop with two berths and a cosy cabin. Mariner 3.3 outboard and good sail wardrobe. She is a regular race winner, twice winning the OGA East Coast Race. Also available, if wanted, four wheel yard trailer, mooring and ground tackle. Lying Essex.
